eula.title: Risk Notice
eula.description:
1. Your Xiaomi user information and device information will be stored in the Home Assistant system. **Xiaomi cannot guarantee the security of the Home Assistant storage mechanism**. You are responsible for preventing your information from being stolen.
2. This integration is maintained by the open-source community. There may be stability issues or other problems. When encountering issues or bugs of this integration, **you should seek help from the open-source community rather than contacting Xiaomi customer service**.
3. You need some technical ability to maintain your local operating environment. The integration is not user-friendly for beginners.
4. Please read the README file before starting.

5. To ensure stable use of the integration and prevent interface abuse, **this integration is only allowed to be used in Home Assistant. For details, please refer to the LICENSE**.

auth_config.title: Basic configuration
auth_config.description:
### Login Region
Select the region of your Xiaomi account. You can find it in the Xiaomi Home APP > Profile (located in the menu at the bottom) > Additional settings > About Xiaomi Home.
### Language
Select the language of the device and entity names. Some sentences without translation will be displayed in English.
### OAuth2 Redirect URL
The OAuth2 authentication redirect address is **[http://homeassistant.local:8123](http://homeassistant.local:8123)**. The Home Assistant needs to be in the same local area network as the current operating terminal (e.g., the personal computer) and the operating terminal can access the Home Assistant home page through this address. Otherwise, the login authentication may fail.
### Integrated Network Configuration
Check if the local network is functioning properly and if the related network resources are accessible. **It is recommended to select this when adding for the first time.**
### Note
- For users with hundreds or more Mi Home devices, the initial addition of the integration will take some time. Please be patient.
- If Home Assistant is running in a Docker environment, please ensure that the Docker network mode is set to host, otherwise local control functionality may not work properly.
- The local control functionality of the integration has some dependencies. Please read the README carefully.

network_detect_config.title: Integrated Network Configuration
network_detect_config.description:
## Usage Introduction
### Network Detection Address
Used to check if the network is functioning properly. If not set, the system default address will be used. If the default address check fails, you can try entering a custom address.
- You can enter multiple detection addresses, separated by commas, such as `8.8.8.8,https://www.bing.com`
- If it is an IP address, detection will be done via ping. If it is an HTTP(s) address, detection will be done via HTTP GET request.
- If you want to restore the system default detection address, please enter a comma `,` and click 'Next'.
- **This configuration is global, and changes will affect other integration instances. Please modify with caution.**
### Check Network Dependencies
Check the following network dependencies one by one to see if they are accessible. If the related addresses are not accessible, it will cause integration issues.
- OAuth2 Authentication Address: `https://account.xiaomi.com/oauth2/authorize`.
- Xiaomi HTTP API Address: `https://{http_host}/app/v2/ha/oauth/get_token`.
- Xiaomi SPEC API Address: `https://miot-spec.org/miot-spec-v2/template/list/device`.
- Xiaomi MQTT Broker Address: `mqtts://{broker_host}`.

homes_select.title: Select Family and Device
homes_select.description:
## Introduction
### Import Device's Family
The integration will add devices from the selected family.
### Room Name Sync Mode
When syncing devices from the Mi Home APP to Home Assistant, the naming of the area in Home Assistant will follow the rules below. Note that the sync process will not change the family and room settings in the Mi Home APP.
- Do not sync: The device will not be added to any area.
- Other options: The area to which the device is added will be named after the family or room name in the Mi Home APP.
### Advanced Settings
Show advanced settings to modify the professional configuration options of the integration.

 
### {nick_name} Hello! Please select the family to which you want to add the device.

advanced_options.title: Advanced Settings
advanced_options.description:
## Introduction
### Unless you are very clear about the meaning of the following options, please keep the default settings.
### Filter Devices
Supports filtering devices by room name and device type, and also supports device dimension filtering.
### Control Mode
- Auto: When there is an available Xiaomi central hub gateway in the local area network, Home Assistant will prioritize sending device control commands through the central hub gateway to achieve local control. If there is no central hub gateway in the local area network, it will attempt to send control commands through Xiaomi OT protocol to achieve local control. Only when the above local control conditions are not met, the device control commands will be sent through the cloud.
- Cloud: All control commands are sent through the cloud.
### Action Debug Mode
For the methods defined by the device MIoT-Spec-V2, in addition to generating notification entities, a text input box entity will also be generated. You can use it to send control commands to the device during debugging.
### Hide Non-Standard Generated Entities
Hide entities generated by non-standard MIoT-Spec-V2 instances with names starting with "*".
### Binary Sensor Display Mode
Display binary sensors in Xiaomi Home as text sensor entity or binary sensor entityã€‚
### Display Device Status Change Notifications
Display detailed device status change notifications, only showing the selected notifications.

devices_filter.title: Filter Devices
devices_filter.description:
## Usage Instructions
Supports filtering devices by home room name, device access type, and device model, and also supports device dimension filtering. The filtering logic is as follows:
- First, according to the statistical logic, get the union or intersection of all included items, then get the intersection or union of the excluded items, and finally subtract the [included summary result] from the [excluded summary result] to get the [filter result].
- If no included items are selected, it means all are included.
### Filter Mode
- Exclude: Remove unwanted items.
- Include: Include desired items.
### Statistical Logic
- AND logic: Take the intersection of all items in the same mode.
- OR logic: Take the union of all items in the same mode.

You can also go to the [Configuration > Update Device List] page of the integration item, check [Filter Devices] to re-filter.

update_trans_rules.title: Update Entities Transformation Rules
update_trans_rules.description:
## Usage Instructions
- Update the entity information of devices in the current integration instance, including MIoT-Spec-V2 multilingual configuration, boolean translation, and model filtering.
- **Warning**: This is a global configuration and will update the local cache. It will affect all integration instances.
- This operation will take some time, please be patient. Check "Confirm Update" and click "Next" to start updating **{urn_count}** rules, otherwise skip the update.

update_lan_ctrl_config.title: Update lan control configuration
update_lan_ctrl_config.description:
## Usage Instructions
Update the configurations for Xiaomi LAN control function. When the cloud and the central hub gateway cannot control the devices, the integration will attempt to control the devices through the LAN. If no network card is selected, the LAN control function will not take effect.
- Only MIoT-Spec-V2 compatible IP devices in the LAN are supported. Some devices produced before 2020 may not support LAN control or LAN subscription.
- Please select the network card(s) on the same network as the devices to be controlled. Multiple network cards can be selected. If Home Assistant have two or more connections to the local area network because of the multiple selection of the network cards, it is recommended to select the one with the best network connection, otherwise it may have bad effect on the devices.
- If there are terminal devices (Xiaomi speaker with screen, mobile phone, etc.) in the LAN that support local control, enabling LAN subscription may cause local automation and device anomalies.
- **Warning**: This is a global configuration. It will affect all integration instances. Please use it with caution.
